column2: John and I sometimes take our books
column3: and sit down on the rocks in the wood
column5: and read stories. And then Carlo will lie down at our feet
column6: and go to sleep; for he cannot understand the nice stories which the other two friends enjoy so much.But wait till we go into the swamps after berries
column7: or into the wood-borders after hazel-nuts. Then Carlo is wide awake
column8: you may be sure. If he sees a snake
column9: what a noise he makes! We can always tell by the tone of his bark when he has found a snake.And
column10: when John climbs a tree after nuts
column11: how anxiously Carlo will stand underneath and watch him
column12: so afraid is he that the little boy will get a fall! And how the good dog will jump and show his pleasure when he sees John once more safe on the firm ground!
